alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster County through 845 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Phillipsport, or near Ellenville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... New Paltz, Ellenville, Wallkill, Modena, Napanoch, Kerhonkson, Wawarsing, Crawford, Gardiner, Port Ben, Flint, Forest Glen, Rutsonville, Galeville, Dwaarkill, Awosting, Dairyland, Lake Minnewaska, Granite and Ireland Corners. People attending Ulster County Fair should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central New York.
